definition: to read/to study (a subject)/to attend (a school)/to read aloud/to give (sb) a tongue-lashing (CL:頓|顿[dun4])/to miss (sb)/idea/remembrance/twenty (banker's anti-fraud numeral corresponding to 廿[nian4])
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Suddenly I had the idea of writing a message in a bottle.
sentences.chinese: “我突然冒出了寫一封“瓶中信”的念頭。

sentences.english: She was surprised by a wanton thought that rushed into her mind.
sentences.chinese: 一個放肆的念頭在她心裏閃過，叫她吃了一驚。

sentences.english: Dianetics class will tell you where these notions come from.
sentences.chinese: 戴尼提研習班會告訴你，這些念頭來自哪裏。

sentences.english: Bigamy lightened the horizon of his shadowy thoughts for a moment.
sentences.chinese: 一時間，在他的思想中模模糊糊閃出了重婚這個念頭。

sentences.english: Imagine an idea as a tabletop.
sentences.chinese: 把一個念頭想象成一張桌面。

sentences.english: If you can't help him, you'd better put him off.
sentences.chinese: 如果你不能幫忙，最好讓人家打消念頭。

sentences.english: Studies show, however, that the notion of anger catharsis is poppycock .
sentences.chinese: 然而，研究表明，怒氣情緒宣泄的念頭根本沒有意義。

sentences.english: King Xerxes had a mad thought in his drunken state.
sentences.chinese: 滿是醉意的亞哈隨魯王突然興起一個瘋狂的念頭。

sentences.english: The promptings of the Holy Spirit will warn you that God is not pleased with the direction your thoughts and feelings are taking you.
sentences.chinese: 聖靈會警示你神不喜悅你念頭和想法的方向。

sentences.english: Be honest with yourself, every time a thought intrudes start counting from the beginning again.
sentences.chinese: 不要欺騙自己，每次一個念頭侵入時就從頭開始計數。

sentences.english: You have to discard any thoughts of disbanding.
sentences.chinese: 你必須丟棄一切解散軍隊的念頭。

sentences.english: They are imbrued with the follies of youth.
sentences.chinese: 他們滿腦子都是年輕人的傻念頭。

sentences.english: I've got something to tell you, I said.
sentences.chinese: 我點頭，心裏已經將這個念頭擴到非說不可的地步了。

sentences.english: Balzac failures never faltered his drive to continue to write novels and novelettes .
sentences.chinese: 他屢屢失敗，但從未放棄過繼續寫小說的念頭。

sentences.english: With what thoughts was the unfortunate man contending?
sentences.chinese: 那倒黴的副主教在哪些念頭裏掙扎？

sentences.english: Why do you allow such silly ideas to come into that head of hers?
sentences.chinese: 你怎麼讓這種傻念頭鑽到她那個怪腦袋裏？

definition: to have an urge/to be impetuous/impulse/urge
determination/resolution/determined/firm and resolute/to make up one's mind/CL:個|个[ge4]
to sway/to waver/to rock/to rattle/to destabilize/to pose a challenge to
to become aware/to detect/to realize/to perceive
